revised_title: The Effects of Elder in Preserving Plants from Insects and Flies
tldr: The author, Christopher Gullet, discovered that elderberry has a strong smell that repels insects and flies. He experimented with using elderberry to protect plants from caterpillars, blights, and crop-destroying flies. Gullet found that elderberry could be used to preserve crops of cabbage, wheat, and turnips from damage. He also suggested that elderberry could be used to protect fruit trees from insects in the future.
